{"role": "Technical Project Manager", "content": "The purpose of user stories is to capture the needs and requirements of the end-users in a concise and understandable format. User stories help to ensure that the development team is building features and functionality that meet the needs of the users and align with the overall project goals. They also provide a clear understanding of what the user wants to achieve, why they want to achieve it, and how it will benefit them. User stories are an important tool for agile development teams to prioritize work and ensure that the most important features are delivered first.", "file_content": "Business Requirements Document  
Snowflake Data Migration Project  
1. Introduction  
The purpose of this document is to outline the business requirements for the Snowflake data migration 
project. The project aims to migrate our existing data warehouse to the Snowflake platform, leveraging 
its scalability, performance, and cloud -native architecture.  
2. Business Objectives  
• Migrate the existing data warehouse to Snowflake, ensuring minimal disruption to ongoing 
operations.  
• Improve data processing performance and scalability to accommodate growing business needs.  
• Enable advanced analytics and reporting capabilities through Snowflake''s features.  
• Enhance data security and compliance with industry standards.  
• Reduce infrastructure and maintenance costs by leveragin g Snowflake''s cloud -based 
infrastructure.  
3. Scope  
The data migration project will encompass the following areas:  
• Analysis and assessment of the current data warehouse infrastructure.  
• Designing the Snowflake data model and schema to accommodate the existin g data.  
• Extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) the data from the current data warehouse to 
Snowflake.  
• Verifying the accuracy and integrity of the migrated data.  
• Implementing necessary data governance and access controls.  
• Optimizing queries and data re trieval performance in Snowflake.  
• Training and knowledge transfer to the relevant teams for ongoing maintenance and usage.  
4. Stakeholders  
• Project Sponsor: [Name]  
• Project Manager: [Name]  
• Data Warehouse Team: [Names]  
• Business Intelligence Team: [Names]  
• IT Operations Team: [Names]  5. Functional Requirements  
5.1 Data Migration  
• Extract data from the current data warehouse, including tables, views, and stored procedures.  
• Transform the data as necessary to align with the Snowflake data model.  
• Load the transformed data into Snowflake using appropriate ETL processes and tools.  
• Ensure data integrity and accuracy during the migration process.  
• Migrate data incrementally to minimize downtime and maintain data consistency.  
5.2 Snowflake Data Model and Schema  
• Analyze the existing data model and schema.  
• Design and create the Snowflake data model and schema to accommodate the migrated data.  
• Define tables, views, and relationships based on business requirements.  
• Optimize the Snowflake data model for performance and  scalability.  
5.3 Data Governance and Security  
• Implement appropriate access controls and permissions in Snowflake.  
• Define data ownership and responsibilities.  
• Establish data governance policies and procedures.  
• Ensure compliance with relevant data privacy r egulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).  
5.4 Performance Optimization  
• Analyze query performance in Snowflake and identify areas for optimization.  
• Optimize SQL queries, indexing, and data partitioning.  
• Monitor and tune performance to ensure efficient data retrieval a nd processing.  
6. Non -Functional Requirements  
6.1 Scalability and Performance  
• Snowflake should handle increasing data volumes and user concurrency without significant 
performance degradation.  
• Response times for queries and data retrieval should meet agreed -upon service -level 
agreements (SLAs).  
6.2 Availability and Reliability  
• Snowflake should provide high availability and ensure minimal downtime.  • Backup and disaster recovery procedures should be in place to protect against data loss.  
6.3 Security and Compliance  
• Snowflake should provide robust security features, including encryption, access controls, and 
auditing capabilities.  
• Compliance with relevant data protection and privacy regulations should be maintained.  
6.4 Usability and User Experience  
• Snowfla ke should have an intuitive user interface and provide ease of use for data analysts, 
business users, and administrators.  
• Training and documentation should be provided to enable users to effectively work with 
Snowflake.  
7. Assumptions and Constraints  
• The proj ect team will have access to the necessary resources, including hardware, software, and 
skilled personnel.  
• The current data warehouse can be effectively extracted from and migrated to Snowflake 
without significant data loss or corruption.  
8. The project timel ine should consider any dependencies on other ongoing projects or system 
upgrades.  
9. Risks and Mitigation Strategies  
• Risk: Data integrity issues during the migration process.  
• Mitigation: Conduct thorough testing and validation of the migrated data at each st age. 
Implement data validation checks and reconciliation processes.  
• Risk: Performance issues in Snowflake affecting query response times.  
• Mitigation: Perform performance testing and optimization, including query tuning, 
indexing, and partitioning strategie s. 
• Risk: Lack of user adoption and resistance to change.  
• Mitigation: Provide comprehensive training and documentation to users. Communicate 
the benefits of Snowflake and address any concerns or resistance through change 
management activities.  
9. Project Timeline  
• Phase 1: Analysis and Assessment  
• Phase 2: Snowflake Data Model and Schema Design  
• Phase 3: Data Extraction and Transformation  • Phase 4: Data Loading and Verification  
• Phase 5: Data Governance and Security Implementation  
• Phase 6: Performance O ptimization and Testing  
• Phase 7: User Training and Knowledge Transfer  
• Phase 8: Go -Live and Post -Implementation Support  
10. Project Deliverables  
• Analysis and assessment report  
• Snowflake data model and schema design  
• Extracted and transformed data sets  
• Migrated a nd verified data in Snowflake  
• Implemented data governance and security measures  
• Performance optimization recommendations and test results  
• User training materials and documentation  
• Go-live and post -implementation support plan  
11. Sign-Off The undersigned stakeh olders acknowledge that they have reviewed and approved the 
business requirements document for the Snowflake data migration project.  
• [Project Sponsor] Date: __________  
• [Project Manager] Date: __________  
 "}
